entry.title: File encoding in Eclipse
entry.content:
While coding my first Rails application in Eclipse using RadRails, I found that my HTML files were not encoded in the correct format. Although I knew that you _can_ specify the default file encoding (e.g. UTF-8) in Eclipse, it took me quite some time to find the corresponding option.
After looking for it for way too long (I guess it felt longer than it was, though), I finally found it in @Window > Preferences > General > Workspace@.

entry.title: Distributing Rails Applications
entry.content:
I just found "this little tutorial":http://www.erikveen.dds.nl/distributingrubyapplications/rails.html on how to package your Rails application into a neat archive for showing it to your customers.
I guess it will come in quite handy for me in a few weeks because I am developing a small application for a friend of mine at the moment, who is not a developer, but wants to run the application locally on his Windows box.
